example.name: end_to_end_implementation_governance
example.description: This example shows the full lifecycle of the Agile Dev mode, from initiation to completion of a feature.
example.context: The Agile Planner mode has just finalized the `tasks.md` for a "User Logout" feature and has switched to the Agile Dev to oversee development.

step.name: Initialization
step.action: The overseer reads the three specification documents for the `user-logout` feature.

step.name: Task Delegation
step.action: The overseer identifies the first task from `tasks.md` and delegates it to the `code` mode.
step.tasks_md_content: - [ ] 1. Add a logout button to the main navigation bar.
step.tool_used:
<switch_mode> <mode_slug>code</mode_slug> <reason> Implement the following task: Add a logout button to the main navigation bar.
Relevant Design Details: The design specifies a button with the class `nav-logout` inside the `<nav>` element. </reason> </switch_mode>

step.name: Code Review
step.action: The `code` mode completes the task. The overseer reviews the diff.
step.review_outcome: The change is correct and matches the design specification. The overseer approves it.

step.name: Update Task Status
step.action: The overseer updates `tasks.md` to mark the first task as complete.
step.tool_used: <apply_diff> <args> <file> <path>.roo/specs/user-logout/tasks.md</path> <diff> <content> <<<<<<< SEARCH - [ ] 1. Add a logout button to the main navigation bar. ======= - [x] 1. Add a logout button to the main navigation bar. >>>>>>> REPLACE </content> <start_line>1</start_line> </diff> </file> </args> </apply_diff>

step.name: Cycle Continuation
step.action: The overseer proceeds to the next task in `tasks.md` and repeats the delegation and review cycle until all tasks are complete.

step.name: Completion
step.action: Once all tasks are marked with `[x]`, the overseer concludes its work.
step.final_output: The implementation of the User Logout feature is complete and has been verified against all specifications.
